questions.question: If one compares compound A composed of non polar molecules with compound B composed of polar molecules, and both molecules have the same molecular formula then it is true that:

answers.a: Both compounds have the same boiling point
answers.c: B boils at a lower temperature than A
answers.d: A boils at a lower temperature than B

explanations.b: Incorrect. All liquids boil at some temperature.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Polar molecules usually have higher boiling points.
explanations.d: Correct. Non-polar A boils at a lower temperature than polar B.

questions.question: For which of the following mixtures would steam distillation be the most appropriate method of separation?

explanations.a: Incorrect. These are miscible and non-decomposing.
explanations.b: Incorrect. These are miscible and have close boiling points.
explanations.c: Correct. Aniline is steam distillable and immiscible with water.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Methanol and water form an azeotrope, not suitable for steam distillation.

questions.question: In the distillation apparatus shown, what are the parts labeled A & B?

explanations.b: Incorrect. The condenser is not directly labeled with the flask.
explanations.c: Correct. Common labeling in apparatus setups.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Thermometer is not labeled as A typically.
